full_text:
MEMORANDUM
Ron Morris
TO:
FROM:
Ruth Billings
January 19, 1993
DATE:
RE:
Kentucky Governor's Proposed Smoking Regulation
On Friday, January 15, I met with Pat Mulloy (Secretary, Finance & Administration
Cabinet), John Fritz (Council for Burley Tobacco), Ed Logsdon (Commissioner of Ag.) and
Bonnie Howell (Mulloy's office) to discuss the Governor's proposed smoking regulation. .
Mulloy presented us with the attached draft, and assured us that every branch would have
smoking and nonsmoking areas other than outside and in the basement. The regulation only
affects the executive branch, not judicial or legislative.
The governor has stated that the regulation will be issued as an emergency regulation. He
hopes to meet with Representative Donnie Gedling and Senator Rick Rand this week to
obtain their approval. If they do approve the regulation the governor wants to make an
announcement next week, and have all those who agree with the regulation present at that
announcement.
Please take a look at the draft and let me know, as soon as possible, if you feel this is
something TI can live with.
R.A.B.
RAB/sfd
Attachment
cc:
Cathey Yoe
TKYL 0000078
